column1: Clayhanger was a  family of Hobbits. Only one member is recorded by name

column2: the name of three hamlets in England (one in West Midlands
column3: one in Cheshire and one in Devon). It comes from Old English cl«£ghangra
column5: "A Dictionary of British Place-Names" As a family name
column6: it is best known from wikipedia:Arnold Burnetts wikipedia:The Clayhanger Family published between 1910 and 1918. The name would likely be used for a family that resides on a clayey wooded slope.
